page.title: 05Horton Common
page.content: Like its near neighbour Holt Heath this was once part of a much larger heath.This site to has been under pressure from other land users. Although it is common land very few people recently have used the grazing rights.As well as it's interest as a habitat it also contains a number of ancient remains,most dating back to the Bronze Age.In the early 1980's despite protests a local farmer fenced off part of the common and ploughed it up with help of a grant to put in improved pasture land.The site remains fenced off but the improvements to it have been abandoned and the land has quickly gone back to scrub.Other parts of this heath have been turned over to scramblind and BMX courses.Other sections are used for rough grazing. This site has a very varied use! .
